online fraud occurs more frequently and is
more unpredictable. Here are some notes to
help.  Users can prevent
fraud on social networks because Meta, the company that
owns the social network Facebook, has just
shared that to prevent serious fraud on the internet,
users should do the following:
first, set up two-factor authentication.
This will help users add an extra
layer of protection to their online accounts,
reducing the risk of unauthorized account access.
Second, authenticate before sending
money or personal information. Be
cautious when approaching unauthorized people.
know each other and avoid sharing
sensitive information or making financial transactions
with third parties.
Use the report feature by
clicking on the dot on a post when you
encounter suspicious content.  This will
help Meta identify and implement
anti-fraud measures.
